question_sentence: More than a million people across Puerto Rico and the Dominican Republic were without power or running water this week due to which hurricane?
evidence: Crews are working to repair critical utilities in the region disabled by Hurricane Fiona.

question_sentence: Britain bid farewell to Queen Elizabeth II with a grand funeral this week. In addition to her two corgi dogs, another one of the Queen’s beloved animals watched her procession. Which kind of animal was it?
evidence: Emma, the Queen’s pony, watched the procession pass by Windsor Castle.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden made a firm declaration about the Covid-19 pandemic this week. What did he say?
evidence: President Biden said he believes the Covid-19 pandemic is “over” in an appearance on CBS’ “60 Minutes,” but acknowledged the US still has a “problem” with the virus that has killed more than 1 million Americans.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled more than 200,000 pickup trucks this week?
evidence: More than 200,000 Nissan pickup trucks were recalled due to a risk that the vehicles could roll away while in park. Nissan’s Frontier and Titan models from the years 2020 through 2023 are the affected vehicles, the company said.

question_sentence: Which WNBA team recently won its first championship title?
evidence: The Las Vegas Aces defeated the Connecticut Sun 78-71 in Game 4 of the WNBA Finals to capture their first title in franchise history.

question_sentence: Which Republican governor claimed credit for flying migrants to Martha’s Vineyard as part of his criticism of the Biden Administration’s immigration policies?
evidence: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis defended his decision to transport 48 Venezuelan migrants to Martha’s Vineyard, Massachusetts, following the announcement of an investigation into the matter by a Texas sheriff.

question_sentence: According to the FAA, how many hours of flight experience are required before a pilot may work for an airline?
evidence: Pilots must have at least 1,500 hours of flight experience. Regional airline Republic Airways had asked the FAA to loosen commercial pilot hiring standards in order to tackle the global pilot shortage, but the request – which drew immense union opposition – was denied this week.

question_sentence: How many Russians could soon be conscripted into the country’s military?
evidence: President Vladimir Putin has announced the immediate “partial mobilization“ of Russian citizens in an escalation of Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. According to Russian officials, about 300,000 reservists will be called up as part of the mobilization.

question_sentence: Which social media platform banned political fundraising this week?
evidence: TikTok has begun to require “mandatory verification” for political accounts based in the United States and will be prohibiting all political fundraising on its short-video platform, the company said Wednesday.

question_sentence: Approximately how many book titles have been banned in US schools over the last year?
evidence: From July 2021 to June 2022, there were 2,532 book bans directed at 1,648 different titles in US schools. About 41% of those were books that tell stories related to LGBTQ people or that have a queer lead or prominent secondary character, according to a new report. Another 40% of the titles have main characters who are people of color, while 21% of titles directly address issues of race and racism, the report said.

question_sentence: The photo above, taken by the James Webb Space Telescope, shows which planet?
The COO of which company was arrested and accused of biting a man’s nose after a college football game?
What substance did Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers say is "not a drug"?
What fashion accessory was First Lady Jill Biden criticized for wearing to Queen Elizabeth II’s funeral?
choices: A fascinator instead of a hat
A pin with the queen's face on it

question_sentence: Who most recently agreed to meet with the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol?
After more than two decades in prison, a judge vacated Adnan Syed's murder conviction. What podcast spawned investigations into Syed's case?
Federal officials said 47 people charged in a $250 mil. pandemic relief scam used the funds for luxury cars instead of what?
After a three-year investigation, New York's attorney general filed a $250 million lawsuit, accusing Donald Trump and three of his kids of what?
choices: Writing bad checks for real estate deals
Business fraud, inflating net worth for personal gain
Real estate fraud, misrepresenting property conditions

question_sentence: Why did it take the Mega Millions $1.34 billion winning ticket holders nearly two months to claim the jackpot?
choices: They were fighting over who bought it
They were out of the country
They were working with financial advisers

question_sentence: After knocking out all of Puerto Rico's power, what storm battered the island this week, causing mass floods and “catastrophic” damage?
Which public service broadcaster is likely to be saved from privatisation after a government U-turn on plans to sell it off?
evidence: Michelle Donelan, who recently replaced Nadine Dorries as culture secretary, has said the “business case” for selling Channel 4 will be re-examined and the sale put on hold.

question_sentence: Before this week’s ceremony for the Queen, for whom was the last state funeral in Britain held?
evidence: The most recent state funeral was for Winston Churchill in 1965. The last held for a sovereign was for the Queen’s father, George VI, in 1952. Both Princess Diana and former PM Thatcher were granted ceremonial, rather than state, funerals.

question_sentence: What percentage of UK adults are behind on one or more household bill, according to a new study?
evidence: Some 10.9m people are behind on one or more household bill – up by 3m since March – said the Money Advice Trust report. The Opinium survey also found 5.6m have gone without food in the past three months due to the cost-of-living crisis.

question_sentence: The Queen’s state funeral was held in Westminster Abbey, but where was she finally laid to rest at a private ceremony attended by the Royal Family?
evidence: The late monarch was buried alongside the Duke of Edinburgh in the King George VI Memorial Chapel, part of St George’s Chapel. The public will be able to visit the chapel from next Thursday.

question_sentence: Which UK city has seen outbreaks of unrest after tensions have risen between young men from sections of the Muslim and Hindu communities?
evidence: Calm has returned to Leicester after a massive police operation was launched to quell unrest that has unsettled the east of the city for three weeks.

question_sentence: How many times in a row has the Bank of England now raised interest rates?
evidence: The Bank has increased its base rate by 0.5 points to 2.25%, the highest it has been since 2008.

question_sentence: Liz Truss has conceded that talks over a free trade deal with which major trading partner are unlikely to start in the “short to medium term”?
evidence: Once hailed as one of Brexit’s great prizes, Liz Truss said a free trade deal with the US will not be struck any time soon as she flew to New York on the first foreign trip of her premiership.

question_sentence: What percentage of Northern Ireland residents are Catholic, according to the latest census data?
evidence: Catholics are the largest religious group in Northern Ireland for the first time since partition. The country was designed to have a permanent Protestant, unionist majority, but larger Catholic families have changed the demographics.

question_sentence: What percentage of trainee GPs plan to work part-time after they qualify, according to a new study?
evidence: Almost two-thirds of trainee GPs plan to work part-time just a year after they qualify due to the stress and intensity of the job, according to a study by The King’s Fund.

question_sentence: Which UK brand found itself at the centre of a PR fiasco when it announced it would close for the Queen’s state funeral as a mark of respect?
evidence: Center Parcs announced that it would close its UK “villages” for the Queen’s funeral, “as a mark of our respect”. It sparked an angry backlash from holidaymakers kicked out of their holiday lodgings, forcing the company to backtrack.
